greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Regular triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of non-crossing set partitions of {1, ..., n} in which all blocks have size k.
link: Germain Kreweras, Sur les partitions non croisées d'un cycle, Discrete Math. 1 333-350 (1972).
formula: If d|n, then T(n, d) = binomial(n, n/d)/(n - n/d + 1); otherwise T(n, k) = 0 [Theorem 1 of Kreweras].
example: Row 6 counts the following non-crossing set partitions (empty columns not shown):
maple: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=1..n), n=1..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 16 2019
xref: Row sums are A194560. Column k=2 is A126120. Trisection of column k=3 is A001764.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 15 2019
